title: MBD-Framework: Memory as Baseline Deviation — Reference Implementations
description:
MBD-Framework provides the computational reference implementations for a six-paper series on Memory as Baseline Deviation (MBD) — a formal framework that models personality, cognition, and social dynamics as state-space systems.

Core Idea

An agent's personality is not a label — it is a vector in state space. Every significant experience shifts that vector according to:

B(t+1) = B(t)(1 − λ) + I(t) · λ

where B is the baseline (resting personality state), I is the input signal (trauma, joy, novelty), and λ is the plasticity parameter — how deeply the event rewrites who you are.

What's in the Repository

  • Agent Architecture (mbd/) — Markov Blanket agents with internal, sensory, and active states; N-dimensional κ-coupling hypercube for relational dynamics
  • Markov Tensor Geometry (markov/) — Tensor library (MarkovTensor → Cube → Hypercube → Tensorium) and Levels of Lucidity engine for dynamic simulation scaling
  • Influence Cube (dynamics/influence_cube.py) — Stella octangula formalization: 3 binary axes (Locus, Coupling, Temporality) producing 8 vertices as dual tetrahedra, with ε river term
  • Social Fabric Simulator (dynamics/social_fabric.py) — Paper-derived agent interaction model integrating MBD baseline deviation, coupling asymmetry, Markov tensor probability, resonant field translation, and emergent gating
  • Quadrafoil Environmental Fields (dynamics/world_evolution.py) — Four poles of environmental influence (sanctuary, arena, market, sink) with 1/r² pressure signatures that shape agent baselines
  • Affective Field Translation (fields/translation.py) — Maps internal affect (Trust, Curiosity, Playfulness, Boldness) onto environmental physics: buoyancy, luminosity, tactile response, resonant harmonics
  • Analysis Tools (analysis/) — Core MBD equations, trauma tensor energy visualization, ecology heatmap
  • Interactive Notebooks (notebooks/) — Jupyter walkthroughs of Paper 1 (Baseline Deviation) and Paper 4 (Executive Load as Eigenstate) with full interactive visualizations
  • MBD Lab (lab/) — Interactive research frontend: FastAPI backend + React/Three.js/Recharts UI with 8 lab pages

Accompanying Papers

  1. Memory as Baseline Deviation — Personality as state-space dynamics; baseline drift under trauma
  2. In Pursuit of the Markov Tensor — Geometric framework for social cognition via tensor lattices
  3. Episodic Recall as Resonant Re-instantiation — Fokker–Planck account of memory retrieval dynamics
  4. The Coupling Asymmetry — Executive dysfunction as an eigenstate of the memory–baseline system
  5. The Emergent Gate — Memory encoding as threshold-dependent consolidation
  6. The Resonant Gate — Conversational insight as phase-locked coupling

Quick Start

pip install -r requirements.txt
python -m analysis.trauma_model       # Core baseline deviation demo
python -m markov.tensor_library        # Markov Tensor demonstration
jupyter notebook notebooks/            # Interactive paper walkthroughs

Requires Python ≥ 3.10, numpy, pydantic, matplotlib. Licensed under Apache 2.0.
